topic: Celery and cross-language queue system test patterns

sources.title: Celery Test Suite Root - Directory Structure
keyInsights: 4-tier test architecture: unit, integration, smoke, benchmarks
Unit tests organized by module: app, backends, concurrency, events, tasks, worker
Smoke tests include failover and quorum queue scenarios
Canvas (workflow) tests are at the top unit level

sources.title: Celery Unit Test Directory
keyInsights: 12 subdirectories covering all major modules
Worker tests split into 14 files covering autoscale, control, consumer, revoke, etc.
Separate test files for canvas, loops, and backends

sources.title: Celery Canvas Unit Tests - Workflow Primitives
keyInsights: Tests freeze/reply_to with thread isolation
Thread-safe UUID generation for task signatures
Canvas operations tested in isolation from broker

sources.title: Celery Worker Control Tests - Rate Limits, Revocation, Pool Management
keyInsights: 12 revocation test variants: by name, with terminate, by stamped headers
Rate limit tests include invalid strings and non-existent tasks
Pool management: grow, shrink, restart, import/reload modules
28+ control commands tested: ping, shutdown, autoscale, rate_limit, etc.
Queue management: add_consumer, cancel_consumer, active_queues

sources.title: Celery Task Request Tests - Execution, Timeout, ACK, Failure
keyInsights: 15+ on_failure variants covering different error types and ACK strategies
Hard and soft timeout handling with acks_late interaction
Task termination and cancellation with pool reference tracking
Unicode/UTF-8 exception handling edge cases
WorkerLostError with varying redelivery states
Backend failures during execution handled defensively

sources.title: Celery Consumer Tests - Prefetch, Reconnection, Shutdown
keyInsights: Prefetch count management: update, restore on restart, disable for non-Redis brokers
Connection error handling with retry progress
Blueprint restart for channel errors with state condition checks
Cancel long-running tasks on connection loss
Preserve successful task results during connection recovery

sources.title: Celery Worker Lifecycle Tests
keyInsights: Graceful shutdown: soft shutdown timeout, idle detection, no-wait mode
Signal handling: SIGINT, WorkerTerminate, WorkerShutdown exceptions
Connection lifecycle: establish, restart, close, heartbeat coordination
QoS/prefetch count management during operation
Revoked task releases concurrency semaphore

sources.title: Celery Heartbeat Tests
keyInsights: Heartbeat start/stop lifecycle
Signal sequence: worker-online, worker-heartbeat, worker-offline
Retry flag behavior: true during operation, false during shutdown
Disabled heartbeat skips all operations

sources.title: Celery Autoscale Tests
keyInsights: Scale up when reserved tasks exceed pool size
Scale down when reserved tasks drop below active processes
No negative scale: min/max bounds enforced
Shrink failure handled gracefully without crash
Prefetch count adjusts with autoscale changes

sources.title: Celery Task Strategy Tests - Rate Limiting, ETA, Revocation
keyInsights: Protocol conversion between Celery proto1 and proto2
TokenBucket rate limiting with countdown
ETA task scheduling with UTC toggle
Revocation check before execution
Event dispatching toggle

sources.title: Celery Redis Backend Tests - Connection, Retry, Chord
keyInsights: Connection error handling: consume, cancel, drain events
PubSub reconnection with and without state change
Retry policy configuration and exception classification
Health check interval validation
Connection pool reuse
Chord apply and unpack operations
SSL/TLS configuration variants

sources.title: Celery Task Result Tests - AsyncResult, GroupResult, Timeout
keyInsights: Result get with timeout and timeout_longer variants
GroupResult join with native mode and timeout
Result propagation for parent tasks
Result forget and pending result removal
Complex group-chain-group join operations
Dependency iteration and completion counting

sources.title: Celery Canvas Integration Tests - 100+ Workflow Tests
keyInsights: 40+ chain tests including nested chains and task replacement
25+ group tests including 1000+ task groups
50+ chord tests including chords within chains within chords
Error propagation testing with Redis-backed state tracking
Errback execution with old-style and new-style handlers
60-second timeout as baseline for workflow completion

sources.title: Celery Memory Leak Integration Tests
keyInsights: Baseline -> stress -> measure pattern for leak detection
3 scenarios: unhandled exceptions, retry failures, nested stacks
Uses psutil RSS or tracemalloc as measurement
Configurable thresholds: 3-10MB depending on scenario
Forced GC between baseline and measurement

sources.title: Celery Smoke Tests - Broker and Worker Failover
keyInsights: Broker failover: kill primary, verify tasks route to secondary
Broker reconnection: restart primary, verify worker reconnects
Worker failover: kill one worker, verify remaining handles tasks
Full cluster restart: kill all workers, restart, verify recovery
task_acks_late=True enables proper recovery behavior

sources.title: Celery Smoke Tests - End-to-End Task Execution
keyInsights: Child process respawn after SIGKILL
Correct error logging after task termination
Soft time limit vs hard time limit interaction
Cross-queue result propagation via task signatures
WorkerLostError on unexpected process exit

sources.title: Sidekiq Test Suite Directory - 47 Test Files
keyInsights: 47 test files covering all major features
Dedicated files for retry, retry_exhausted, dead_set
Sharding tests for multi-Redis setups
ActiveJob adapter compatibility tests
Middleware chain testing

sources.title: Sidekiq Retry Tests - Comprehensive Backoff and Exhaustion
keyInsights: Retry with nil worker, numeric retry, retry=0, retry=false
Time-based retry windows (retry_for) override max_retries
Custom delay per exception type
Discard and kill strategies for specific error types
Error message edge cases: encoding, broken .message, fallback
Backtrace saving and cleaning
Retry queue routing to alternate queues
Shutdown exception: no retry for work-in-progress

sources.title: Sidekiq Scheduled Job Tests
keyInsights: Schedule polling with randomized intervals
Poll interval scales with process count
Termination halts job enqueuing
Timestamp assertions use assert_in_delta for tolerance
Client middleware execution during schedule

sources.title: Sidekiq Processor Tests - Execution, ACK, Error Handling
keyInsights: ACK tested in 5 contexts: before/after middleware, skip, exception, normal
Invalid JSON handling
Requeue with original arguments preserved
Exception re-raised after handling
Statistics increment on process

sources.title: Sidekiq API Tests - Queue Inspection and Job Management
keyInsights: Queue state: size, latency, paused status
Job enumeration with pagination and ordering
Dead set: kill, retry, clear operations
Scheduled set: move to queue, kill, find by JID
Retry set: fetch by score/JID, reschedule, clear, scan
Job removal while iterating safely
Process and worker enumeration

sources.title: Sidekiq Dead Set Tests - Dead Letter Queue Management
keyInsights: Dead jobs stored with full serialized data
TTL-based auto-pruning of old dead jobs
Max size enforcement: oldest removed when exceeded
3 focused tests covering the essential DLQ behaviors

sources.title: Sidekiq Middleware Tests
keyInsights: Middleware execution order (onion model)
Non-yielding middleware halts chain
Replace vs duplicate middleware handling
Prepend middleware positioning
Middleware receives Redis and logging context

sources.title: Sidekiq Launcher Tests - Process Lifecycle
keyInsights: Process info stored in Redis with TTL
Heartbeat event fires exactly once
Quiet mode changes process title to 'stopping'
Memory collection in test environment

sources.title: Sidekiq Client Tests - Push, Middleware, Bulk, Scheduling
keyInsights: Bulk push with batch size configuration
Middleware can stop individual bulk jobs
Scheduled jobs spread over intervals
Strict argument validation (Symbol, Date, Hash, Struct)
Sharding: route jobs to different Redis pools
Retry after Redis failure

sources.title: BullMQ Test Suite Directory - 32 Test Files
keyInsights: 32 test files covering all major features
Stress test file for job scheduler
Dedicated files for stalled_jobs, rate_limiter, deduplication
Job cancellation has basic and advanced test files
Cluster, connection, and lock manager tests

sources.title: BullMQ Stalled Jobs Tests - Detection, Recovery, Max Count
keyInsights: 14 test cases covering all stall scenarios
maxStalledCount enforcement with counter persistence
Parent-child interaction: failParent, ignoreDependency, removeDependency, continueParent
removeOnFail variants for stalled-then-failed jobs
Lock extension prevents false stall detection
skipStalledCheck option for opt-out

sources.title: BullMQ Rate Limiter Tests - Global, Dynamic, Priority
keyInsights: 13 test cases covering global and per-worker limits
Dynamic rate limiting via worker.rateLimit()
Rate limit interaction with priority ordering
Burst handling with max > 1
Quick worker close during rate-limited wait
Rate limit during queue pause

sources.title: BullMQ Delay Tests - Ordering, Accuracy, Multi-Worker
keyInsights: 12 delay test cases
FIFO ordering for identical timestamps
Multi-worker cooperation on delayed job promotion
Short delay added after long delay processes first
Failed retry jobs moved to delayed do not get stuck
Delay interaction with queue pause

sources.title: BullMQ Connection Tests - Resilience, Cluster, Auth
keyInsights: Recovery from connection loss with job continuity
Jobs added before/after disconnect all processed
Worker closes even when Redis is down
Fast close does not leak connections
Connection failure modes: invalid host, invalid URL
Error event emission on connection failure

sources.title: BullMQ Concurrency Tests - Limits, Locking, Dynamic
keyInsights: Global concurrency via setGlobalConcurrency
Drained event fires exactly once
Lock expiration does not stuck jobs at max concurrency
Backoff strategy interaction with concurrency
Stalled job recovery respects group order

sources.title: BullMQ Flow Tests - Parent-Child Dependencies, Failure Propagation
keyInsights: 30+ flow test cases
4 failure propagation modes: failParent, continueParent, ignoreDependency, removeDependency
Nested flows: grandchild -> child -> parent cascading
Flow with priority, backoff, removeOnFail, removeOnComplete per child
Edge cases: duplicate child, already-completed parent, concurrent child additions

sources.title: BullMQ Worker Tests - 100+ Processing Patterns
keyInsights: 100+ worker test cases
LIFO queue processing
Progress tracking: number, object, string, boolean types
removeOnComplete/removeOnFail with count, age, and combined
Worker name set on job during processing
drainDelay and blockTimeout configuration
autorun=false for manual start control

sources.title: BullMQ Pause Tests - Queue and Worker Pause
keyInsights: 11 pause test cases
Graceful pause: waits for active jobs to finish
Local worker pause vs global queue pause
Multi-worker local pause isolation
Blocking retrieval completion before pause
Delayed jobs blocked during pause

sources.title: BullMQ Deduplication Tests - TTL, Extend, Replace
keyInsights: Debounce and deduplication as separate concepts
TTL-based dedup with extend option
Replace option removes previous delayed job
Manual dedup key removal
Dedup key lifecycle tied to job state

sources.title: BullMQ Clean Tests - State-Based Cleanup
keyInsights: 16 clean test cases
Clean by state: completed, failed, waiting, delayed, prioritized
Grace period preservation
Limit parameter enforcement
Both 'wait' and 'waiting' state names accepted

sources.title: BullMQ Metrics Tests
keyInsights: 4 metrics test cases
Time-bucketed metrics with maxDataPoints limit
Completed and failed job counters
Pagination for large metric datasets

sources.title: BullMQ Events Tests - Lifecycle, Ordering, Trimming
keyInsights: Job lifecycle event ordering: waiting -> active -> completed
Parent-child event sequence: waiting-children -> waiting
Event stream trimming with maxLen
Multiple QueueEvents instances receive same events
Custom event publishing
Drained event uniqueness

sources.title: BullMQ Job Cancellation Tests - AbortSignal, Active Job Tracking
keyInsights: AbortSignal integration for active job cancellation
Backward compatible: processor ignoring signal still works
Cancel non-existent or completed job returns false
Cancel all active jobs
Manual cancellation on lock renewal failure
Active job list tracking

sources.title: BullMQ Job Scheduler Tests - Cron, Repeat, Upsert
keyInsights: 30+ scheduler test cases
Cron patterns and every-N-ms intervals
startDate in future/past, endDate enforcement
Upsert idempotency: concurrent upserts produce exactly one scheduler
Clock sync edge cases
Remove and re-add scheduler
Custom cron strategies and RRULE patterns

sources.title: BullMQ Cluster Tests - Multi-Node, Auth, Worker
keyInsights: Cluster connection duplication with options
Worker retrieval from all cluster nodes
Job processing, delays, retries in cluster mode
Authentication propagation across cluster connections
No explicit failover or node failure tests

sources.title: BullMQ Bulk Operations Tests
keyInsights: 4 bulk test cases
Batch add with processing verification
Parent dependency in bulk operations
Custom job IDs in bulk
Missing: partial failure, large batch, error handling

sources.title: BullMQ Job Tests - Creation, Validation, Progress, Logs
keyInsights: 40+ job test cases
Size limit validation with non-ASCII data
Conflicting option detection (delay+repeat, mutually exclusive failure modes)
Priority range and type validation
Progress tracking: number, object, string, boolean
Job log ordering (asc/desc) and retention
Falsy value handling (zero as data)
Bulk removal performance: 4000 jobs in time range
